Operation 'GetContactByIdentifiers' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Get Contacts by Identifiers' is too generic and doesn't clarify the 'exact match' requirement that distinguishes this endpoint. Description is verbose and mixes operational details with recommendations. Improved summary emphasizes 'exact identifier values' for clarity. Improved description reorganizes information into clear Input/Output/Status sections, explicitly states the partial match behavior and return structure, clarifies when to use this endpoint vs. Search Contacts, and removes the backup recommendation which is outside the operation's scope. This structure significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve up to 100 contacts that match the requested identifier values for a single identifier type.

`identifier_type` must be a valid identifier type: `email`, `phone_number_id`, `external_id`, or `anonymous_id`.

Use this endpoint instead of the [Search Contacts endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/contacts/search-contacts) when you can provide exact identifiers and do not need to include other [Segmentation Query Language (SGQL)](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) filters when searching.

This endpoint returns a `200` status code when any contacts match the identifiers you supplied. When searching multiple identifier values in a single request, it is possible that some will match a contact while others will not. When a partially successful search like this is made, the matching contacts are returned in an object and an error message is returned for the identifier values that are not found.

This endpoint returns a `404` status code when no contacts are found for the provided identifiers.

This endpoint returns a `400` status code if any searched addresses are invalid.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve contacts by exact identifier values
data.description_suggestion:
Retrieves up to 100 contacts matching exact identifier values for a single identifier type (email, phone_number_id, external_id, or anonymous_id). Use this endpoint for exact identifier lookups without needing Segmentation Query Language (SGQL) filters.

**Input:** Specify the identifier_type path parameter and provide identifier values in the request body.

**Output:** Returns matching contacts in the response body. Supports partial matches - returns found contacts and error details for unmatched identifiers.

**Status Codes:**
- 200: One or more contacts matched (may include partial results)
- 404: No contacts found for provided identifiers
- 400: Invalid identifier values provided

**Use Case:** Prefer this endpoint over Search Contacts when you have exact identifiers and do not require additional filtering criteria.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Contacts by Identifiers' is too generic and doesn't clarify the 'exact match' requirement that distinguishes this endpoint. Description is verbose and mixes operational details with recommendations. Improved summary emphasizes 'exact identifier values' for clarity. Improved description reorganizes information into clear Input/Output/Status sections, explicitly states the partial match behavior and return structure, clarifies when to use this endpoint vs. Search Contacts, and removes the backup recommendation which is outside the operation's scope. This structure significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Add or Update a Contact' is too generic for bulk operations. Description is verbose and scattered. Improved summary emphasizes the bulk nature and asynchronous behavior. Reorganized description to clearly state: purpose, limits, async nature, response format, job tracking, update requirements, side effects (email normalization), and prerequisites. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (bulk contact management) and what to expect (async processing with job tracking).

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows the [upsert](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/upsert) (insert or update) of up to 30,000 contacts, or 6MB of data, whichever is lower**.
Because the creation and update of contacts is an asynchronous process, the response will not contain immediate feedback on the processing of your upserted contacts. Rather, it will contain an HTTP 202 response indicating the contacts are queued for processing or an HTTP 4XX error containing validation errors. Should you wish to get the resulting contact's ID or confirm that your contacts have been updated or added, you can use the [Get Contacts by Identifiers operation](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/contacts/get-contacts-by-identifiers).
Please note that custom fields need to have been already created if you wish to set their values for the contacts being upserted. To do this, please use the [Create Custom Field Definition endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/custom-fields/create-custom-field-definition).
You will see a `job_id` in the response to your request. This can be used to check the status of your upsert job. To do so, please use the [Import Contacts Status endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/contacts/import-contacts-status).
If the contact already exists in the system, any entries submitted via this endpoint will update the existing contact. In order to update a contact, all of its existing identifiers must be present. Any fields omitted from the request will remain as they were. A contact's ID cannot be used to update the contact.
The email field will be changed to all lower-case. If a contact is added with an email that exists but contains capital letters, the existing contact with the all lower-case email will be updated.
data.description_suggestion: Upserts (inserts or updates) up to 30,000 contacts or 6MB of data, whichever is lower. This is an asynchronous operation that queues contacts for processing. Returns HTTP 202 with a `job_id` to track the upsert status via the Import Contacts Status endpoint. Requires all existing identifiers to be present for updates; omitted fields remain unchanged. Email addresses are normalized to lowercase. Custom fields must be pre-created before setting their values. Use Get Contacts by Identifiers to retrieve the resulting contact IDs after processing completes.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Add or Update a Contact' is too generic for bulk operations. Description is verbose and scattered. Improved summary emphasizes the bulk nature and asynchronous behavior. Reorganized description to clearly state: purpose, limits, async nature, response format, job tracking, update requirements, side effects (email normalization), and prerequisites. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (bulk contact management) and what to expect (async processing with job tracking).

message: Operation 'DeleteContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary 'Delete Contacts' is too vague about scope and async nature. Description lacks clarity on parameter requirements and return value. Improved summary specifies 'one or more' and 'asynchronously' for better AI agent understanding. Reorganized description to clearly state: action, async nature, parameter options (with XOR requirement), return format, and critical side effect (irreversibility). Helps agents understand when to use this operation and the consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to delete one or more contacts**.

The query parameter `ids` must set to a comma-separated list of contact IDs for bulk contact deletion.

The query parameter `delete_all_contacts` must be set to `"true"` to delete **all** contacts. 

You must set either `ids` or `delete_all_contacts`.

Deletion jobs are processed asynchronously.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete one or more contacts asynchronously
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more contacts asynchronously. Accepts either a comma-separated list of contact IDs via the `ids` query parameter for selective deletion, or set `delete_all_contacts` to "true" to delete all contacts (exactly one parameter required). Returns HTTP 202 with a `job_id` to track deletion status. Deletion is irreversible; Twilio SendGrid recommends regular contact exports as backup.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Delete Contacts' is too vague about scope and async nature. Description lacks clarity on parameter requirements and return value. Improved summary specifies 'one or more' and 'asynchronously' for better AI agent understanding. Reorganized description to clearly state: action, async nature, parameter options (with XOR requirement), return format, and critical side effect (irreversibility). Helps agents understand when to use this operation and the consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint will return up to 50 of the most recent contacts uploaded or attached to a list**. 

This list will then be sorted by email address.

Please note that pagination of the contacts has been deprecated.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve sample of recent contacts sorted by email
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves up to 50 of the most recent contacts, sorted by email address. This endpoint provides a sample view of your contact database and does not support pagination. Returns the full contact count along with the sample contacts. Useful for quick verification or monitoring of recent contact activity.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get Sample Contacts' is vague about what 'sample' means and sorting behavior. Description lacks clarity on return value (contact count) and use case. Improved summary specifies the limit, recency, and sorting. Reorganized description to clarify: limit, sorting, return values (sample + count), pagination status, and use case. Helps AI agents understand this is for quick sampling rather than comprehensive retrieval.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint is used to retrieve a set of contacts identified by their IDs.**

This can be more efficient endpoint to get contacts than making a series of individual `GET` requests to the "Get a Contact by ID" endpoint.

You can supply up to 100 IDs. Pass them into the `ids` field in your request body as an array or one or more strings.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve multiple contacts by IDs in single request
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves multiple contacts in a single request by their IDs, more efficient than individual GET requests. Accepts up to 100 contact IDs in the request body `ids` field as an array of strings. Returns full contact details for all matching IDs. Useful for bulk retrieval operations when you have a set of known contact IDs.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get Batched Contacts by IDs' is vague about the efficiency benefit and batch nature. Description lacks clarity on input format flexibility and return value. Improved summary emphasizes efficiency and batch operation. Reorganized description to clearly state: purpose, efficiency benefit, input limits and format, return value, and use case. Helps AI agents understand when to use this over individual GET requests.

Helps AI agents understand the operation's limitations and when it will fail.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to delete one identifier from a contact.**

Deletion jobs are processed asynchronously.

Note this is different from deleting a contact. If the contact has only one identifier, the asynchronous request will fail. All contacts are required to have at least one identifier.

The request body field `identifier_type` must have a valid value of "EMAIL", "PHONENUMBERID", "EXTERNALID", or "ANONYMOUSID".
data.summary_suggestion: Remove single identifier from contact asynchronously
data.description_suggestion: Removes a single identifier from a contact asynchronously. Requires the `identifier_type` field in the request body with valid values: "EMAIL", "PHONENUMBERID", "EXTERNALID", or "ANONYMOUSID". Returns HTTP 202 with a `job_id` to track deletion status. Operation will fail if the contact has only one identifier, as all contacts must maintain at least one identifier. This operation differs from deleting the entire contact.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Delete a Contact Identifier' lacks context about async nature and constraint. Description is unclear about return value and doesn't emphasize the critical constraint (minimum one identifier required). Improved summary specifies 'single', 'asynchronously', and the constraint. Reorganized description to clearly state: action, async nature, required parameters with valid values, return format, critical constraint (with failure condition), and distinction from contact deletion. Helps AI agents understand the operation's limitations and when it will fail.

message: Operation 'ExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Export Contacts' is too generic and doesn't indicate the asynchronous nature. Description is verbose and procedural rather than explaining the operation's purpose and effects. Added clarity about asynchronous processing, required/optional parameters, return values, and workflow. Improved AI agent interpretability by clearly stating inputs, outputs, and side effects.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to export lists or segments of contacts**.

If you would just like to have a link to the exported list sent to your email set the `notifications.email` option to `true` in the `POST` payload.

If you would like to download the list, take the `id` that is returned and use the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request to each URL provided to download your CSV file(s).

You specify the segments and or/contact lists you wish to export by providing the relevant IDs in, respectively, the `segment_ids` and `list_ids` fields in the request body.

The lists will be provided in either JSON or CSV files. To specify which of these you would required, set the request body `file_type` field to `json` or `csv`.

You can also specify a maximum file size (in MB). If the export file is larger than this, it will be split into multiple files.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous export job for contacts from specified lists or segments. Accepts `list_ids` and/or `segment_ids` to define which contacts to export. Supports JSON or CSV output format via the `file_type` parameter. Optionally specify a maximum file size to split large exports into multiple files. Returns a job `id` and optional email notification URL. Use the returned `id` with the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint to retrieve download URLs once processing completes. Supports optional email delivery of export links via `notifications.email`.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Export Contacts' is too generic and doesn't indicate the asynchronous nature. Description is verbose and procedural rather than explaining the operation's purpose and effects. Added clarity about asynchronous processing, required/optional parameters, return values, and workflow. Improved AI agent interpretability by clearly stating inputs, outputs, and side effects.

message: Operation 'ListExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Get All Existing Exports' is vague about what is being retrieved. Description is wordy and includes unnecessary procedural guidance. Improved summary to clearly indicate listing export jobs. Streamlined description to focus on what the operation returns and its purpose, making it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this endpoint.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all current exported jobs**.

It will return an array of objects, each of which records an export job in flight or recently completed. 

Each object's `export_type` field will tell you which kind of export it is and its `status` field will indicate what stage of processing it has reached. Exports which are `ready` will be accompanied by a `urls` field which lists the URLs of the export's downloadable files  there will be more than one if you specified a maximum file size in your initial export request.

Use this endpoint if you have exports in flight but do not know their IDs, which are required for the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all contact export jobs, including those in progress and recently completed. Returns an array of export job objects, each containing `export_type`, `status`, and optional `urls` fields. The `status` field indicates the job's processing stage (pending, in-progress, ready, failed). When status is `ready`, the `urls` field contains download links for the exported file(s). Use this endpoint to discover export job IDs when you don't have them, or to monitor the status of multiple exports simultaneously.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get All Existing Exports' is vague about what is being retrieved. Description is wordy and includes unnecessary procedural guidance. Improved summary to clearly indicate listing export jobs. Streamlined description to focus on what the operation returns and its purpose, making it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'GetExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, not_actionable. Summary 'Export Contacts Status' is vague and doesn't indicate the action clearly. Description is procedural and includes irrelevant backup recommendations. Improved summary to be action-oriented and specific about retrieving both status and URLs. Clarified that the `id` parameter is required and comes from the export creation endpoint. Removed non-essential guidance to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a contact export job**. 

To use this call, you will need the `id` from the "Export Contacts" call.

If you would like to download a list, take the `id` that is returned from the "Export Contacts" endpoint and make an API request here to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request on each URL to download your CSV file(s).

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve export job status and download URLs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status and details of a specific contact export job using its `id` (obtained from the "Export Contacts" endpoint). Returns the job's `status` field indicating processing stage (pending, in-progress, ready, failed) and, when ready, a `urls` field containing download links for the exported file(s). Use this endpoint to monitor export progress and obtain download URLs once processing completes.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Export Contacts Status' is vague and doesn't indicate the action clearly. Description is procedural and includes irrelevant backup recommendations. Improved summary to be action-oriented and specific about retrieving both status and URLs. Clarified that the `id` parameter is required and comes from the export creation endpoint. Removed non-essential guidance to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'ImportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary 'Import Contacts' is too generic and doesn't convey the two-step asynchronous process. Description is extremely verbose with unnecessary examples and backup recommendations. Improved summary to indicate asynchronous job initiation. Restructured description to clearly explain the two-step workflow, required parameters, constraints, and return values. Removed procedural curl examples and backup guidance to improve clarity and AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows a CSV upload containing up to one million contacts or 5GB of data, whichever is smaller. At least one identifier is required for a successful import.**

Imports take place asynchronously: the endpoint returns a URL (`upload_uri`) and HTTP headers (`upload_headers`) which can subsequently be used to `PUT` a file of contacts to be imported into our system.

Uploaded CSV files may also be [gzip-compressed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gzip).

In either case, you must include the field `file_type` with the value `csv` in your request body.

The `field_mappings` parameter is a respective list of field definition IDs to map the uploaded CSV columns to. It allows you to use CSVs where one or more columns are skipped (`null`) or remapped to the contact field.

For example, if `field_mappings` is set to `[null, "w1", "_rf1"]`, this means skip column 0, map column 1 to the custom field with the ID `w1`, and map column 2 to the reserved field with the ID `_rf1`. See the "Get All Field Definitions" endpoint to fetch your custom and reserved field IDs to use with `field_mappings`.

Once you receive the response body you can then initiate a **second** API call where you use the supplied URL and HTTP header to upload your file. For example:

`curl --upload-file "file/path.csv" "URL_GIVEN" -H "HEADER_GIVEN"`

If you would like to monitor the status of your import job, use the `job_id` and the "Import Contacts Status" endpoint.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a two-step asynchronous contact import process. First, this endpoint returns an `upload_uri` and `upload_headers` for uploading a CSV file (up to 1 million contacts or 5GB, whichever is smaller). Supports gzip-compressed files. Requires `file_type: "csv"` and at least one contact identifier. The optional `field_mappings` parameter maps CSV columns to contact fields, allowing column skipping or remapping. Returns a `job_id` for monitoring import progress via the "Import Contacts Status" endpoint. Second step: use the returned `upload_uri` and `upload_headers` to PUT your CSV file to the provided URL.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Import Contacts' is too generic and doesn't convey the two-step asynchronous process. Description is extremely verbose with unnecessary examples and backup recommendations. Improved summary to indicate asynchronous job initiation. Restructured description to clearly explain the two-step workflow, required parameters, constraints, and return values. Removed procedural curl examples and backup guidance to improve clarity and AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'GetImportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Summary 'Import Contacts Status' is vague and doesn't indicate what information is retrieved. Description is verbose with unnecessary backup recommendations. Improved summary to be action-oriented and specific about retrieving status and results. Clarified status values and their meanings in a more concise format. Added clarity about the `errors_url` field for error handling. Removed non-essential guidance to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a contact import job**. 

Use the `job_id` from the "Import Contacts," "Add or Update a Contact," or "Delete Contacts" endpoints as the `id` in the path parameter.

If there is an error with your `PUT` request, download the `errors_url` file and open it to view more details.

The job `status` field indicates whether the job is `pending`, `completed`, `errored`, or `failed`. 

Pending means not started. Completed means finished without any errors. Errored means finished with some errors. Failed means finished with all errors, or the job was entirely unprocessable: for example, if you attempt to import file format we do not support.

The `results` object will have fields depending on the job type.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve import job status and results
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status and results of a contact import job using its `job_id` (obtained from the "Import Contacts," "Add or Update a Contact," or "Delete Contacts" endpoints). Returns the job's `status` field with values: `pending` (not started), `completed` (finished without errors), `errored` (finished with some errors), or `failed` (finished with all errors or unprocessable file). When errors occur, an `errors_url` field provides a downloadable file with error details. The `results` object contains job-specific outcome information.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Import Contacts Status' is vague and doesn't indicate what information is retrieved. Description is verbose with unnecessary backup recommendations. Improved summary to be action-oriented and specific about retrieving status and results. Clarified status values and their meanings in a more concise format. Added clarity about the `errors_url` field for error handling. Removed non-essential guidance to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'SearchContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary 'Search Contacts' is too generic and doesn't indicate the SGQL requirement. Description lacks clarity about return value limits and doesn't mention the alternative email search endpoint. Improved summary to specify SGQL usage. Restructured description to clearly state the 50-contact limit, email handling requirements, timestamp format, timeout behavior, and when to use alternative endpoints. Better AI agent interpretability for understanding when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to locate contacts**.

The request body's `query` field accepts valid [SGQL](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) for searching for a contact.

Because contact emails are stored in lower case, using SGQL to search by email address requires the provided email address to be in lower case. The SGQL `lower()` function can be used for this.

Only the first 50 contacts that meet the search criteria will be returned.

If the query takes longer than 20 seconds, a `408 Request Timeout` status will be returned.

Formatting the `created_at` and `updated_at` values as Unix timestamps is deprecated. Instead, they are returned as ISO format as string.
data.description_suggestion: Searches for contacts using Segmentation Query Language (SGQL) syntax in the `query` field. Returns up to 50 matching contacts. Email addresses are stored in lowercase; use the SGQL `lower()` function when searching by email. Note: email searches are case-insensitive in the request but results are lowercase. Timestamps (`created_at`, `updated_at`) are returned in ISO 8601 format. Queries exceeding 20 seconds return a `408 Request Timeout` error. For exact email matching without SGQL filters, use the "Get Contacts by Emails" endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Search Contacts' is too generic and doesn't indicate the SGQL requirement. Description lacks clarity about return value limits and doesn't mention the alternative email search endpoint. Improved summary to specify SGQL usage. Restructured description to clearly state the 50-contact limit, email handling requirements, timestamp format, timeout behavior, and when to use alternative endpoints. Better AI agent interpretability for understanding when and how to use this operation.

Summary 'Get Contacts by Emails' is vague about the exact nature of the operation. Description is overly verbose with unnecessary backup recommendations and procedural guidance. Improved summary to clearly indicate exact email matching. Restructured description to focus on key details: return limit, field matching, case handling, response codes, and when to use alternative endpoints. Removed non-essential guidance and backup recommendations to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve up to 100 contacts matching the searched `email` address(es), including any `alternate_emails`.** 

Email addresses are unique to a contact, meaning this endpoint can treat an email address as a primary key to search by. The contact object associated with the address, whether it is their `email` or one of their `alternate_emails` will be returned if matched.

Email addresses in the search request do not need to match the case in which they're stored, but the email addresses in the result will be all lower case. Empty strings are excluded from the search and will not be returned.

This endpoint should be used in place of the "Search Contacts" endpoint when you can provide exact email addresses and do not need to include other [Segmentation Query Language (SGQL)](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) filters when searching.

If you need to access a large percentage of your contacts, we recommend exporting your contacts with the "Export Contacts" endpoint and filtering the client side results.

This endpoint returns a `200` status code when any contacts match the address(es) you supplied. When searching multiple addresses in a single request, it is possible that some addresses will match a contact while others will not. When a partially successful search like this is made, the matching contacts are returned in an object and an error message is returned for the email address(es) that are not found. 

This endpoint returns a `404` status code when no contacts are found for the provided email address(es).

A `400` status code is returned if any searched addresses are invalid.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve contacts by exact email addresses
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves up to 100 contacts matching the provided email address(es), including matches against `email` and `alternate_emails` fields. Email searches are case-insensitive in requests but returned in lowercase. Returns `200` with matching contacts when any addresses match; partial matches return both matching contacts and error messages for unmatched addresses. Returns `404` when no contacts match any provided addresses. Returns `400` if any email addresses are invalid. Empty strings are excluded from searches. Use this endpoint for exact email lookups; use "Search Contacts" for complex SGQL-based filtering.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get Contacts by Emails' is vague about the exact nature of the operation. Description is overly verbose with unnecessary backup recommendations and procedural guidance. Improved summary to clearly indicate exact email matching. Restructured description to focus on key details: return limit, field matching, case handling, response codes, and when to use alternative endpoints. Removed non-essential guidance and backup recommendations to improve AI agent interpretability.
